scene.name: intro
scene.option: I hope I didn't wake you up?

scene.name: wake-you
scene.line: No, I can't really get comfortable enough to sleep anymore, except in the car. Oh, not driving! In the passenger's seat, reclined. Eric drove me around the reservoir this afternoon and I got an hour or two in.

scene.name: watching-tv
scene.line: I couldn't get settled in bed, so I was just watching TV; some cooking show about high-concept junk food, and ... everyone from my high school chemistry class was there ... making cupcakes out of ... old bicycle parts ...
I think I `might` have dozed off a bit, actually.

scene.name: ready
scene.line: Honestly, this baby can come out whenever he wants — I'm completely over it!
scene.option: Don't rush it! Just try to get some rest.
Good for you — you sound really confident.

scene.name: dont-rush
scene.line: That's what Eric says. Ha ha. I guess it'll happen when it happens. I mean, obviously it —

scene.name: confident
scene.line: Oh, it's all an act. I'm actually —

scene.name: interruption
scene.line: `(The phone line makes a horrible sound.)`
Whoa! God, the phones down here are such a mess.
Hey, Cate, I really appreciate you checking in. I have your pager number, and so does Eric, just in case I'm too, um, distracted or whatever.
I'll let you go. I should try to eat something.
scene.option: Reishi will help with your joint pain.
Try some of that lichen oil I left, just to help settle your stomach.
Munch on a "bitter hedgehog" cap. That should relieve some of your intestinal discomfort.

scene.name: food-recommendation
scene.line: OK, thanks ... maybe I'll just chew on some ice.
Talk to you soon, Cate. Hopefully!
